meanings.definition: A tropical tree of the pea family, bearing long pods containing sweet edible pulp.
meanings.sent1: The algarroba tree provides delicious fruit for animals in the forest.
meanings.sent2: I enjoyed the taste of the algarroba pod during my nature walk.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys in the jungle had a party, feasting on the algarroba pods.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as sweet as the algarroba pulp inside the pod.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the algarroba tree filled the air with a tropical sweetness.

meanings.definition: The sweet pulp of the pods of the algarroba tree, used as a substitute for chocolate.
meanings.sent1: I baked cookies with algarroba pulp instead of chocolate chips.
meanings.sent2: The algarroba paste added a rich flavor to the dessert.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled as they tried the algarroba pudding, thinking it was chocolate.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was as deep and satisfying as algarroba in a dessert.
meanings.sent5: The algarroba spread on toast was a delightful morning treat.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight in Spain and Spanish-speaking countries, equal to about 25 pounds.
meanings.sent1: The farmer sold a sack of potatoes weighing one algarroba.
meanings.sent2: The algarroba measurement was used to weigh the harvest.
meanings.sent3: Carrying an algarroba of books in his backpack made him walk slowly.
meanings.sent4: The burden of his secrets felt heavier than an algarroba of stones.
meanings.sent5: The algarroba weight was a challenge for the old scale to handle.
